Pre-Game Insights: Ireland will have to beat the high-flying United States of America to make it to the Super 8 stages.
The Irish side will first have to beat the United States of America, then hope for an Indian win over Canada and also beat Pakistan in their final match on Sunday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Irish side began with a huge loss to India and a shock loss to Canada that has left them in troubled waters.
Ireland's bad starts to the innings have cost them dear.
The pair of Lorcan Tucker and Harry Tector have the ability to play the big innings and are naturally attacking with the bat.
Curtis Campher is a decent hitter of the ball and also can bowl effectively.
George Dockrell is not only an able batter but also the lead spinner.
Mark Adair has been impressing everyone with his steady bowling and is also more than capable with the bat.
Barry McCarthy and Craig Young have been putting up consistent performances and delivering wickets at regular intervals for their side.
Others: Ireland's predicted XI for the game against USA: Andrew Balbirnie, Paul Stirling(C), Lorcan Tucker (WK), Harry Tector, Curtis Campher, George Dockrell, Gareth Delaney, Mark Adair, Barry McCarthy, Craig Young, and Joshua Little.
